events.description: The Frankfurt DAX 40 index closed higher on Friday, ending a three-day losing streak.
A fresh batch of corporate earnings from both sides of the Atlantic were assessed by traders.

facts.fact_text: The DAX 40 closed approximately 0.9% higher at 24,721.5 on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: Frankfurt's DAX 40 managed to close about 0.9% firmer at 24,721.5 on Friday

facts.fact_text: Renk shares rose 6.1% following rating upgrades by BNP Paribas and Exane.

evidences.evidence_text: Renk surged 6.1% after BNP Paribas and French broker Exane raised their ratings on the stock.

facts.fact_text: The DAX index rose 0.7% over the course of the week.

evidences.evidence_text: For the week, the index rose 0.7%.

claims.claim_text: Market anxiety regarding massive spending on AI has decreased to some extent.
claims.author: Traders

evidences.evidence_text: nervousness around AI-massive spending easing somewhat.

claims.claim_text: Negative developments at Stellantis caused downward pressure on the broader automotive sector.

evidences.evidence_text: Negative news from Stellantis pressured the automotive sector

evidence.evidence_text: Siemens Energy (+3.9%) outperformed, boosted by better-than-expected results and strong 2026 guidance from US peer Bloom Energy.
Negative news from Stellantis pressured the automotive sector, with Volkswagen, Daimler Truck, BMW, and Porsche Automobil falling up to 1.2%.
Traders assessed a fresh batch of corporate earnings from both sides of the Atlantic, with nervousness around AI-massive spending easing somewhat.
